name: BEST WESTERN of Birch Run/Frankenmuth

reviews.text: this hotel was pretty nice... not the best hotel in the world but a great value. the breakfast was simple but filling. the afternoon drinks and popcorn were nice. the pool was small but nicely heated. the staff was not extremely helpful but thats fine. located outside frankenmuth and very close to the birch run outlet store and lots of fast food and sit-down dinner restaurants. i liked this hotel a lot!
reviews.title: pretty good

reviews.text: Usually stay in Saginaw at Four Points and wish we stuck to that plan! Thank god we're only here one night! Room is very small and dirty!! Beds are very uncomfortable feels like your sleeping on the floor...with one small pillow each. I'm very itchy and I am hoping it's just my imagination....because of the uncleanliness. Can't wait till morning so I can get out of this hell hole..don't think I'll be doing much sleeping....!!!
reviews.title: Never Again
champagne tastes for a beer bottle pocket!
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I stay here every time we visit the outlet mall down the street. While the Four Seasons it surely is not, it is a great hotel for a reasonable price. We always stay in the honeymoom suite which is the cheapest jacuzzi suite in the entire area. The room is huge and the flat screen in the middle of the room swivels around so you can watch it in bed or in the tub. The room, bathroom, tub, etc.. are all immaculately clean though the products they use are somewhat strong for people like myself with sensitivities to such things.

The manager's reception is a nice touch. You get 2 free drink coupons and if you order an appetizer your party drinks for free the whole reception. The bartender is nice if a bit inattentive. The pool is located right off the bar area and it is kind of a pain to have to walk outside in the winter all the way from your room if you are in the back. They do have a little changing area off to the side.
reviews.title: OK I SUPPOSE.....

reviews.text: The reception staff is EXTREMELY accomodating especially with late check out times. I recommend making the drive to Frankemuth for dinner but avoid the chicken places. Tiffany's is a little bar/pizza place/mid-range restaurant on the main drag and has the most amazingly creative pasta-pizza dishes.
reviews.title: Very Large, Clean Room

reviews.text: ......THIS HOTEL....is NOT what we expected. When we arrived we could barely find the lobby because the sign is hidden behind trees. In the lobby was a small display; on top of THAT was a pair of BALLED-UP DIRTY SOCKS! Over the stay we counted about 5 bugs, one of which was found on one of us after sleeping in THEIR beds. One of the LAMPS DIDNT WORK, THE CARPET WAS FILTHY! -cant stress that enough!- Front desk barely answered phones, and had the nerve to ask if extra people were in the room after we requested FRESH linens. (apparently they weren't provided). And after all that we didn't bother trying the food.
reviews.title: They won't see me again!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed there to shop at Birch Run. The room with king bed was very comfortable and the free breakfast was better than average. Extremely low price (<$60). The wireless Internet was a bit flaky. Cleared up the Internet problem using a LAN cable. The new Meijer store is close by for any incidentals. Was surprised that it wasn't noisier because it is right beside I-75. It is odd that the hotel does not have a pay phone.. I think they want to make money on the private long distance system they subscribe to.
reviews.title: Not Bad, Good Price

reviews.text: Went to the Best Western and were fine with room and service. Basically right across the street from the Point centre plaza but ended up at the genevesse shopping centre in Flint because we didn`t feel there were much deals to be had at Point Centre. The motel was clean and the price was right. It was $60 per night during the week. However, we were real disappointed in the pool which was merky and cold. The pool area was much to be desired and seemed underkept and dirty.
reviews.title: Birch Run Shopping

reviews.text: If your not a smoker, this hotel is fine. I am a smoker and booked my room online. Apparently the smoking rooms are not in the hotel but in a different building behind the hotel. Every time my kids wanted to go swimming, we had to hop in the car and drive to the main hotel. We couldn't just walk down to the pool. The smoking rooms are the same price as the non smoking rooms. Although the rooms looked like something you'd find on 8 mile. I know all the non smokers out there are like good, I don't like the smell of smoke anyways. At least the price should reflect what the rooms look like and be 1/2 price for what you get. I would never pay that price again for this hotel for what you get. I went to birch run to stay at a nice hotel. If I wanted to stay in a dump, I would've went down to 8 mile in Detroit.
reviews.title: Dissapointed in smoking rooms

likes.disliked: — The rooms seperated away from the main building, away from the pool.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: To make an incredibly long story short, I am one of a dozen people who were over charged for their stay. According to the manager, the facilities nightly audit over charged their guests 3-4 times their original bill. When I called they were rude and tried to tell me I didn't know what I was talking about. Five days later my checking account is still in the negative and have been slapped with late fees and nonsufficient funds fees. I have been told day after day that they are taking care of it, and yet I am still unable to pay for groceries or put gas in my car. I am not the type of person that would typically write such a negative review, but this hotel has completely inconvenienced my husband and I in the worst way. So I caution you... beware of your stay. You may end up paying more than you had EVER expected!!!!
reviews.title: DISASTER!!! ...and still paying for it.

reviews.text: This hotel is fifty years old, and though it is listed as newly renovated, it is hard to believe that anything was done more that applying paint. The hallway smell and are dark and dingy. We were three females on a shopping trip to the outlet center in Birch Run and looking at the sites in Frankenmuth. We asked for a roll away bed for the third person. The bed had springs coming out of it. However, this was changed on our request the next day. The coffee pot did not work properly and we were promised a replacement which either never arrived or had the same problem. The breakfast was set up for a quarter of the people who were eating - with one person doing her best to look after the huge crowd that she was expected to serve. She was amazing and certainly the star employee. The phone is not answered in the evening. When I asked about this I was told that there was only one person on the desk at night and if she is busy checking someone in she is unable to answer the phone. My husband attempted to call several times. I was asked by was of an email to comment on my stay, which I did. The following day I received a replay from the hotel from the Executive Housekeeper. I presume that the manager is also overworked!
reviews.title: I cannit recommend this hotel to anyone!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the hotel for two nights. The second morning we were told we had to move rooms for some reason. We asked since we were having to move if we can have a free upgrade to a King size bed room and make sure we are in the new room by 11 since we had to check our of our other room then and it was not busy the night before, they said yes. We did not get into our room until 4:30 and we got two double beds and we had two queens the night before. This really messed are day up and it showed how the staff did not care about their guests at all. They seemed to not care at all about there mess up and did not even say sorry. Americans eh...
reviews.title: Terrible staff

reviews.text: Great place if ur planning to shop around the area, all the major hotels around the neighborhood too, near the Birch Run outlet mall, n Frankenmuth ect,
reviews.title: Convient close to the Birch Run outlet mall.

reviews.text: Needed a 1 night stay after shopping at Birch Run and Frankenmuth...and I didin't want to spend a ton of $. This Best Western was perfect. Clean, comfortable, large room, pool, free breakfast, and the right price under $80.
reviews.title: Super value-close to everything

reviews.text: My only wish was that breakfast was 'better'. The only choices were runny scrambled eggs, biscuts and gravy and make your own waffle. No bagels, toast, meats etc.
reviews.title: Good Value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I decided to take a Monday - Wednesday shopping trip to Birch Run. The hotel's proximity to the Outlet Mall was perfect. There was only one other hotel closer. Total drive time: 2 minutes....We were booked into a main floor suite - parked our truck right outside our room. Room was very nice and newly updated - dresser, desk, heart-shaped jacuzzi tub and flat screen tv with separate sleeping area with king size bed corner fireplace and another flat screen - had separate bathroom and lots of closet space to hang and store all of our purchases. Breakfast in the a.m. was fine, it was free - we made our own waffles, toast, cereal and they had plenty of coffee and juice. They give you tickets to manager's cocktail party from 5-7 - you get one free drink but if you purchase an appetizer for at least $5, then you can continue to drink for free until 7 p.m. We ordered Garlic bread and mozzarella sticks - both were delicious - we drank and ate for 2 hours and it cost us $11.50 - not bad at all! We were hoping to use the pool, whirlpool and especially the gym....but found ourselves too busy. Great location for Flint shopping as well. We will definitely stay at this hotel again.
reviews.title: Great Location, Great Price, Great Cocktail Party

reviews.text: We were looking for a a lower cost hotel to stay in that was close to both Deer Run and Frankenmuth for our Girl's Shopping weekend away. The hotel is newly renovated (the vast history of the hotel is available on the walls near the desk). There is a small pool and 'hot tub' (which wasn't very hot but by the time we got there). We tried to hit the 'adult' hour past 10pm which was a nice feature. The bar had 'complimentary drinks' the first night which was nice - the "restaurant" did not have a very extensive menu though - it's mostly a bar food.
reviews.title: Adequate hotel which served it's purpose, I would stay again.

reviews.text: The room was at at the back; well away from the busy highway and was very quiet. The bathroom was tiny but clean. It was a very cold and windy weekend so we had the heat on a few times - it worked nicely. Beds were hard but served their purpose. Wi-fi worked great without troubles. People were very friendly and accomodating. We didn't need our room cleaned and put out the do-not-disturb sign. We got a hand written note in the door saying that if we needed anything we could go to the front desk.
reviews.title: Would stay here again

reviews.text: Stayed here while attending the 80s festival in Frankenmuth. This is not a "fancy" place but we weren't planning to spend much time at the hotel, just wanted a clean place to sleep at night.
reviews.title: wonderful

reviews.text: *The rate was very reasonable - we cancelled our reservation at a swankier place in Frankenmuth, as we were able to stay here at BW 2 nights for less than the price of 1 night at the other place, and it included free breakfast in the a.m. Can't beat that deal!!!
reviews.title: Really good hotel

aka: Best Western Of Birch Run / Frankenmuth Hotel Birch Run
